thm r1pwALT(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ On →(c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0))))
} = {
  pm2.61i((c0 ∈ On →(c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)))), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  vtoclg(hs0, c1, universe, (c0 ∈ On →(c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)))), (c0 ∈ On →(hs0 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(hs0)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)))))
  imbi2d(hs0 = c1, c0 ∈ On, (hs0 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(hs0)∈(R1 ` suc(c0))), (c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0))))
  bibi12d(hs0 = c1, hs0 ∈(R1 ` c0), P(hs0)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)), c1 ∈(R1 ` c0), P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)))
  eleq1(hs0, c1, (R1 ` c0))
  eleq1d(P(hs0), (R1 ` suc(c0)), P(c1), hs0 = c1)
  pweq(hs0, c1)
  bitr4d(c0 ∈ On, hs0 ∈(R1 ` c0), P(hs0)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)), (rank ` P(hs0))∈ suc(c0))
  syl6bbr(c0 ∈ On, hs0 ∈(R1 ` c0), (rank ` P(hs0))∈ suc(c0), suc((rank ` hs0))∈ suc(c0))
  bitrd(c0 ∈ On, hs0 ∈(R1 ` c0), suc((rank ` hs0))∈ suc(c0), (rank ` hs0)∈ c0)
  rankr1a(c0, hs0)
  syl(c0 ∈ On, ((rank ` hs0)∈ c0 ↔ suc((rank ` hs0))∈ suc(c0)), Ord(c0))
  eloni(c0)
  ordsucelsuc(c0, (rank ` hs0))
  eleq1i((rank ` P(hs0)), suc(c0), suc((rank ` hs0)))
  rankpw(hs0)
  syl(c0 ∈ On, (P(hs0)∈(R1 ` suc(c0))↔(rank ` P(hs0))∈ suc(c0)), suc(c0)∈ On)
  suceloni(c0)
  rankr1a(suc(c0), P(hs0))
  pwex(hs0)
  vex(hs0)
  a1d(¬ c1 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ On, (c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0))))
  pm5.21ni(c1 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈(R1 ` c0), P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)))
  elex(c1, (R1 ` c0))
  sylibr(P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)), c1 ∈ 𝕌, P(c1)∈ 𝕌)
  elex(P(c1), (R1 ` suc(c0)))
  pwexb(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ On →(c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` suc(c0)))))
}

blocks.name: r1pwcl
blocks.content: The cumulative hierarchy of a limit ordinal is closed under power set. (Contributed by Raph Levien, 29-May-2004.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm r1pwcl(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wlim(c0), wb(wcel(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0))))
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(wlim(c0), wcel(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1))))
  a1i(wlim(c0), wi(wcel(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))))
  jca(wcel(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))
  r1elwf(c1, c0)
  elfvdm(c1, cr1, c0)
  a1i(wlim(c0), wi(wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))))
  jca(wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))
  sylibr(wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(cpw(c1), cuni(cima(cr1, con0))))
  r1elwf(cpw(c1), c0)
  elfvdm(cpw(c1), cr1, c0)
  ex(wlim(c0), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1))), wb(wcel(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0))))
  3bitr4d(wa(wlim(c0), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))), wcel(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cfv(crnk, c1), c0), wcel(cfv(crnk, cpw(c1)), c0))
  bitr4d(wa(wlim(c0), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))), wcel(cfv(crnk, c1), c0), wcel(cfv(crnk, cpw(c1)), c0), wcel(csuc(cfv(crnk, c1)), c0))
  adantr(wlim(c0), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1))), wb(wcel(cfv(crnk, c1), c0), wcel(csuc(cfv(crnk, c1)), c0)))
  limsuc(c0, cfv(crnk, c1))
  eleq1d(cfv(crnk, cpw(c1)), c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, c1)), wa(wlim(c0), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))))
  ad2antrl(wlim(c0), wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)), wceq(cfv(crnk, cpw(c1)), csuc(cfv(crnk, c1))))
  rankpwi(c1)
  adantl(wlim(c0), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1))), wb(wcel(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cfv(crnk, c1), c0)))
  rankr1ag(c1, c0)
  adantl(wlim(c0), wa(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1))), wb(wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cfv(crnk, cpw(c1)), c0)))
  sylanb(wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)), wb(wcel(cpw(c1), cfv(cr1, c0)), wcel(cfv(crnk, cpw(c1)), c0)), wcel(cpw(c1), cuni(cima(cr1, con0))))
  pwwf(c1)
  rankr1ag(cpw(c1), c0)
}

thm r1pwcl(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (Lim(c0)→(c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0)))
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(Lim(c0), c1 ∈(R1 ` c0), P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0), (c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1)))
  a1i(Lim(c0), (c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)→(c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1))))
  jca(c1 ∈(R1 ` c0), c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On), c0 ∈ dom(R1))
  r1elwf(c1, c0)
  elfvdm(c1, cr1, c0)
  a1i(Lim(c0), (P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0)→(c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1))))
  jca(P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0), c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On), c0 ∈ dom(R1))
  sylibr(P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0), c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On), P(c1)∈ ⋃(R1 " On))
  r1elwf(P(c1), c0)
  elfvdm(P(c1), cr1, c0)
  ex(Lim(c0), (c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1)), (c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔ P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0)))
  3bitr4d((Lim(c0)∧(c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1))), c1 ∈(R1 ` c0), P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0), (rank ` c1)∈ c0, (rank ` P(c1))∈ c0)
  bitr4d((Lim(c0)∧(c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1))), (rank ` c1)∈ c0, (rank ` P(c1))∈ c0, suc((rank ` c1))∈ c0)
  adantr(Lim(c0), (c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1)), ((rank ` c1)∈ c0 ↔ suc((rank ` c1))∈ c0))
  limsuc(c0, (rank ` c1))
  eleq1d((rank ` P(c1)), c0, suc((rank ` c1)), (Lim(c0)∧(c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1))))
  ad2antrl(Lim(c0), c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On), c0 ∈ dom(R1), (rank ` P(c1))= suc((rank ` c1)))
  rankpwi(c1)
  adantl(Lim(c0), (c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1)), (c1 ∈(R1 ` c0)↔(rank ` c1)∈ c0))
  rankr1ag(c1, c0)
  adantl(Lim(c0), (c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On)∧ c0 ∈ dom(R1)), (P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0)↔(rank ` P(c1))∈ c0))
  sylanb(c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On), c0 ∈ dom(R1), (P(c1)∈(R1 ` c0)↔(rank ` P(c1))∈ c0), P(c1)∈ ⋃(R1 " On))
  pwwf(c1)
  rankr1ag(P(c1), c0)
}

thm rankuni(class c0) {
  ⊢ (rank ` ⋃ c0)= ⋃(rank ` c0)
} = {
  pm2.61i((rank ` ⋃ c0)= ⋃(rank ` c0), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, universe, (rank ` ⋃ c0)= ⋃(rank ` c0), (rank ` ⋃ hs0)= ⋃(rank ` hs0))
  eqeq12d((rank ` ⋃ hs0), ⋃(rank ` hs0), (rank ` ⋃ c0), ⋃(rank ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2d(crnk, ⋃ hs0, ⋃ c0, hs0 = c0)
  unieq(hs0, c0)
  unieqd((rank ` hs0), (rank ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, crnk)

  eqtri((rank ` ⋃ hs0), ⋃ { hs1 | ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 =(rank ` hs2))}, ⋃(hs2 ∈ hs0,(rank ` hs2)))
  rankuni2(hs2, hs0)
  dfiun2(hs2, hs1, hs0, (rank ` hs2))
  fvex(crnk, hs2)
  unissi({ hs1 | ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 =(rank ` hs2))}, (rank ` hs0))
  abssi(hs1, (rank ` hs0), ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 =(rank ` hs2)))
  sylbi(∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 =(rank ` hs2)), hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), ∃(hs2,(hs2 ∈ hs0 ∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2))))
  df-rex(hs2, hs0, hs1 =(rank ` hs2))
  sylib(∃(hs2,(hs2 ∈ hs0 ∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2))), hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), ∃(hs2,((rank ` hs2)∈(rank ` hs0)∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2))))
  eximi(hs2, (hs2 ∈ hs0 ∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2)), ((rank ` hs2)∈(rank ` hs0)∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2)))
  anim1i(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 =(rank ` hs2), (rank ` hs2)∈(rank ` hs0))
  rankel(hs2, hs0)
  vex(hs0)
  3bitr3i(∃(hs2,((rank ` hs2)∈(rank ` hs0)∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2))), hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), ∃(hs2,(hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0)∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2))), (hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0)∧ ∃(hs2, hs1 =(rank ` hs2))))
  19.42v(hs2, hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), hs1 =(rank ` hs2))
  exbii(hs2, (hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0)∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2)), ((rank ` hs2)∈(rank ` hs0)∧ hs1 =(rank ` hs2)))
  pm5.32ri(hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), hs1 =(rank ` hs2), (rank ` hs2)∈(rank ` hs0))
  eleq1(hs1, (rank ` hs2), (rank ` hs0))
  impbii((hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0)∧ ∃(hs2, hs1 =(rank ` hs2))), hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0))
  simpl(hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), ∃(hs2, hs1 =(rank ` hs2)))
  ancli(hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), ∃(hs2, hs1 =(rank ` hs2)))
  syl(hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), ∃(hs2, hs1 =(rank ` hs2)), hs1 =(rank `(R1 ` hs1)))
  eqcomd(hs1, (rank `(R1 ` hs1)), hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0))
  sylib(hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0), (rank `(R1 ` hs1))= hs1, hs1 ∈ dom(R1))
  syl6eleqr(hs1, dom(R1), con0, hs1 ∈(rank ` hs0))
  oneli(hs1, (rank ` hs0))
  rankon(hs0)
  ax-mp(dom(R1)= On, R1[Fn]On)
  r1fnon()
  fndm(cr1, con0)
  rankr1id(hs1)
  spcev(hs2, (R1 ` hs1), hs1 =(rank `(R1 ` hs1)), hs1 =(rank ` hs2))
  fvex(cr1, hs1)
  eqeq2d(hs1, (rank ` hs2), (rank `(R1 ` hs1)), hs2 =(R1 ` hs1))
  fveq2(hs2, (R1 ` hs1), crnk)
  sseqtri(⋃(rank ` hs0), (rank ` ⋃ hs0), ⋃ suc((rank ` ⋃ hs0)))

blocks.name: rankr1b
blocks.content: A relationship between rank and ` R1 ` . See ~ rankr1a for the membership version. (Contributed by NM, 15-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm rankr1b(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wb(wss(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wss(cfv(crnk, c1), c0)))
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  sylbir(wcel(c0, con0), wb(wss(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wss(cfv(crnk, c1), c0)), wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)))
  eleq2i(c0, cdm(cr1), con0)
  ax-mp(wceq(cdm(cr1), con0), wfn(cr1, con0))
  r1fnon()
  fndm(cr1, con0)
  mpan(wcel(c0, cdm(cr1)), wb(wss(c1, cfv(cr1, c0)), wss(cfv(crnk, c1), c0)), wcel(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))))
  eleqtrri(c1, cuni(cima(cr1, con0)), universe)
  unir1()
  rankr1bg(c1, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm rankr1b(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ On →(c1 ⊆(R1 ` c0)↔(rank ` c1)⊆ c0))
  ⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  sylbir(c0 ∈ On, (c1 ⊆(R1 ` c0)↔(rank ` c1)⊆ c0), c0 ∈ dom(R1))
  eleq2i(c0, dom(R1), con0)
  ax-mp(dom(R1)= On, R1[Fn]On)
  r1fnon()
  fndm(cr1, con0)
  mpan(c0 ∈ dom(R1), (c1 ⊆(R1 ` c0)↔(rank ` c1)⊆ c0), c1 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On))
  eleqtrri(c1, ⋃(R1 " On), universe)
  unir1()
  rankr1bg(c1, c0)
}

thm ranksuc(class c0) {

} = {
  eqtri(cfv(crnk, csuc(c0)), csuc(cfv(crnk, c0)), cfv(crnk, cun(c0, csn(c0))))

  uneq2i(cfv(crnk, c0), cfv(crnk, csn(c0)), csuc(cfv(crnk, c0)))

thm ranksuc(class c0) {
  ⊢ (rank ` suc(c0))= suc((rank ` c0))
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  eqtri((rank ` suc(c0)), suc((rank ` c0)), (rank `(c0 ⋃ { c0 })))

  df-suc(c0)
  eqtri((rank `(c0 ⋃ { c0 })), suc((rank ` c0)), ((rank ` c0)⋃(rank ` { c0 })))

  snex(c0)

blocks.name: rankval4
blocks.content: The rank of a set is the supremum of the successors of the ranks of its members. Exercise 9.1 of [Jech] p. 72. Also a special case of Theorem 7V(b) of [Enderton] p. 204. (Contributed by NM, 12-Oct-2003.)

thm rankval4(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wceq(cfv(crnk, c0), ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))))

} = {
  eqssi(cfv(crnk, c0), ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))))
  sstri(cfv(crnk, c0), ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))), cfv(crnk, cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))))))
  ax-mp(wss(cfv(crnk, c0), cfv(crnk, cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0))))))), wss(c0, cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))))))
  mpgbir(s0, wss(c0, cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))))), wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0))))))))
  dfss2f(s0, c0, cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0))))))
  nfcv(s0, c0)
  nffv(s0, cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))))
  nfcv(s0, cr1)
  nfiu1(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0))))
  mpi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))))), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cr1, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0))))))
  rankid(cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  sseld(cv(s0), cfv(cr1, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)))), cfv(cr1, ciun(s0, c0, csuc(cfv(crnk, cv(s0))))), wcel(cv(s0), c0))

  syl(wlim(cfv(crnk, cxp(c0, c1))), wlim(cuni(cuni(cfv(crnk, cxp(c0, c1))))), wlim(cuni(cfv(crnk, cxp(c0, c1)))))

thm rankxplim2(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (Lim((rank `(c0 × c1)))→ Lim((rank `(c0 ⋃ c1))))
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  mpcom(Lim((rank `(c0 × c1))), Lim((rank `(c0 ⋃ c1))), (c0 × c1)≠ ∅)
  sylib(Lim((rank `(c0 × c1))), (c0 × c1)≠ ∅, ¬(rank `(c0 × c1))= ∅)
  syl(Lim((rank `(c0 × c1))), ¬(rank `(c0 × c1))= ∅, ∅ ∈(rank `(c0 × c1)))
  0ellim((rank `(c0 × c1)))
  n0i(emptycls, (rank `(c0 × c1)))
  bitr2i(¬(rank `(c0 × c1))= ∅, (c0 × c1)≠ ∅, ¬(c0 × c1)= ∅)
  df-ne((c0 × c1), emptycls)
  notbii((c0 × c1)= ∅, (rank `(c0 × c1))= ∅)
  rankeq0((c0 × c1))
  xpex(c0, c1)
  syl5ib((c0 × c1)≠ ∅, Lim((rank `(c0 × c1))), Lim((rank `(c0 ⋃ c1))), Lim(⋃ ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1))))
  syl(Lim((rank `(c0 × c1))), Lim(⋃ ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1))), Lim(⋃(rank `(c0 × c1))))
  limuni2((rank `(c0 × c1)))
  limuni2(⋃(rank `(c0 × c1)))
  syl((c0 × c1)≠ ∅, (Lim(⋃ ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1)))↔ Lim((rank `(c0 ⋃ c1)))), ⋃ ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1))=(rank `(c0 ⋃ c1)))
  syl5eq(⋃ ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1)), (rank `(c0 ⋃ c1)), (rank ` ⋃ ⋃(c0 × c1)), (c0 × c1)≠ ∅)
  eqtr2i(⋃ ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1)), (rank ` ⋃ ⋃(c0 × c1)), ⋃(rank ` ⋃(c0 × c1)))
  rankuni(⋃(c0 × c1))
  unieqi((rank ` ⋃(c0 × c1)), ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1)))
  rankuni((c0 × c1))
  fveq2d(crnk, ⋃ ⋃(c0 × c1), (c0 ⋃ c1), (c0 × c1)≠ ∅)
  unixp(c0, c1)
  limeq(⋃ ⋃(rank `(c0 × c1)), (rank `(c0 ⋃ c1)))
}

blocks.content: The rank of a Cartesian product is a limit ordinal iff its union is. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2006.)

blocks.name: rankxpsuc
blocks.content: The rank of a Cartesian product when the rank of the union of its arguments is a successor ordinal. Part of Exercise 4 of [Kunen] p. 107. See ~ rankxplim for the limit ordinal case. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2006.)

blocks.name: tcwf
blocks.content: The transitive closure function is well-founded if its argument is. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Jun-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm tcwf(class c0) {

  fvex(ctc, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(cima(cr1, con0)))
}

thm tcwf(class c0) {

}

blocks.name: tcrank
blocks.content: This theorem expresses two different facts from the two subset implications in this equality. In the forward direction, it says that the transitive closure has members of every rank below ` A ` . Stated another way, to construct a set at a given rank, you have to climb the entire hierarchy of ordinals below ` ( rank `` A ) ` , constructing at least one set at each level in order to move up the ranks. In the reverse direction, it says that every member of ` ( TC `` A ) ` has a rank below the rank of ` A ` , since intuitively it contains only the members of ` A ` and the members of those and so on, but nothing "bigger" than ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Jun-2013.)
